page.title: 18EDUCATION IN DRUMOAK
page.content: The parish of Drumoak at one time could boast no fewer than three schools:{Glashmore School}under the patronage of the Kirk Session,{Drumoak {North School and Drumoak Central School. Smaller families and less pupils have meant the closure of two of the schools in the 20th century. The Central School now known as Drumoak School is the only school left in the parish. The Head Teacher and staff of three teachers look after a roll of 82 pupils divided into four classes: P1/2, P3/4, P5/6 and P7. When pupils have completed their Primary education,they transfer at the age of 11-12 to{Banchory Academy Secondary School six miles away. Nearly a third of the pupils at Drumoak come to school by bus, the remainder live in the housing areas near to the school.
